message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.SY, cs.LG 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper focuses on content-centric mobile hybrid IoT networks and analyzes the throughput-delay trade-off under a multihop-based content delivery protocol. This falls under the scope of networking and internet architecture. 
2. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper discusses a cache allocation strategy for mobile devices and static FAPs to optimize the content delivery in IoT networks. This involves information theory concepts such as coding and compression. 
3. cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) - The paper presents a new cache allocation strategy that jointly finds the replication sets at mobile devices and static FAPs via a novel variable decoupling approach. This involves designing efficient algorithms for cache allocation. 
4. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper analyzes the order-optimal throughput-delay trade-off in mobile hybrid IoT networks under a general multihop-based content delivery protocol. This involves modeling and control of complex systems. 
5. cs.LG (Machine Learning) - The paper uses a Zipf popularity distribution to model the content requests in the IoT network and presents a cache allocation strategy to optimize the content delivery. This involves machine learning concepts such as probability distributions and optimization.
